content.text: Security headers are instructions sent by your server to browsers, telling them how to handle your website's content and protect against various attacks. These headers act as a defense mechanism, preventing common web vulnerabilities.

Missing or misconfigured security headers leave your website vulnerable to attacks like XSS (Cross-Site Scripting), clickjacking, MIME-sniffing, and data injection. Proper security headers are essential for protecting both your website and your users.

content.title: HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security)
content.text: Forces browsers to always use HTTPS (secure connection) when accessing your site, preventing downgrade attacks and man-in-the-middle attacks. Example: Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains

content.title: Content Security Policy (CSP)
content.text: Prevents untrusted scripts from other domains from executing on your site, protecting against XSS attacks. It defines which sources are allowed to load resources. Example: Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'

content.title: X-Frame-Options
content.text: Prevents your website from being embedded in iframes on other sites, protecting against clickjacking attacks. Options: DENY (no embedding), SAMEORIGIN (same origin only), or ALLOW-FROM (specific origin).

content.title: X-Content-Type-Options
content.text: Prevents browsers from MIME-sniffing, reducing the risk of XSS attacks. Should be set to 'nosniff' to prevent browsers from guessing content types.

content.title: X-XSS-Protection
content.text: Enables the browser's built-in XSS filter. While modern browsers have this enabled by default, explicitly setting it helps with older browsers. Should be set to '1; mode=block'.

content.title: Referrer-Policy
content.text: Controls how much referrer information is sent with requests. Options include 'no-referrer', 'same-origin', 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin', etc. Helps protect user privacy.

items: Missing headers that should be present
Always include HSTS for HTTPS sites
Set X-Frame-Options to DENY or SAMEORIGIN
Regularly audit and update header configurations
Test headers using security header analysis tools
